newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: RESEARCH ALERT-Ayala Land a buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-Ayala Land a buy.

text.p: Sun Hung Kai Securities said on Friday it recommended a buy on Ayala Land Inc (ALI) because of its highly diversified property portfolio that would cushion it from a downturn in certain segments of the industry.

"Despite a slowdown in the take-up of its high-end residential condominium projects, ALI is well-positioned to weather any isolated slump through its retail and office space rentals," analyst Eliza Silvestre said in a study.
Sun Hung Kai said it expects earnings per share (EPS) growth of about 20 percent in 1997 and 1998, with EPS forecast at 65 centavos in 1997 from 54 centavos in 1996 and 78 centavos in 1998.
Ayala Land's income will be drawn from rental revenues from commercial and office spaces, and low- to medium-income housing developments, the brokerage house said.
The company reported recently a first half net income of 2.66 billion pesos, a five percent growth from the year-earlier 2.54 billion.
"Interim growth was not spectacular because the first semester of 1996 was unusually high due to a number of project launches during the period," Sun Hung Kai said.

ALI, which closed at 19.25 pesos, is still trading at a 46 percent discount to its net asset value of 35.91 pesos a share, which includes its land bank of 2,670 hectares and other investments, Sun Hung Kai said.
